title: Task 1: Identify a work of art
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: Response does not provide two accurate identifiers for the selected work of art.
Response provides two accurate identifiers for the selected work of art.

title: Task 2: Describe visual elements of a work of art
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: Response does not accurately describe a visual characteristic or technique used to create the All-T’oqapu tunic.
Response does accurately describe a visual characteristic or technique used to create the All-T’oqapu tunic.

title: Task 3: Describe visual elements of a work of art
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: Response does not accurately describe a visual characteristic or technique used to create the selected work of art.
Response does accurately describe one visual characteristic or technique used to create the selected work of art.

title: Task 4: Explain how two or more works of art are similar and/or different in how they convey meaning
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: Response does not use specific evidence from both works to explain a similarity or difference in how both works communicate their function as luxury items through their design, material, or technique.

Response does accurately use specific evidence from both works to explain one similarity or difference in how both works communicate their function as luxury items through their design, material, or technique.

Response does accurately use specific evidence from both works to explain two similarity and/or differences in how both works communicate their function as luxury items through their design, material, or technique.

title: Task 5: Articulate a defensible claim that explains the meaning or significance of similarities or differences between two works of art
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: Response does not accurately explain a similarity or difference in how both works communicate social status within their respective cultures.
Response does accurately explain one similarity or difference in how both works communicate social status within their respective cultures.

title: Task 6: Explain how the evidence justifies the claim
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: Response does not use specific evidence from the All-T’oqapu tunic in the explanation.
